turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Network analyzer (AC power).
turn.1: When did the analog network analyzers stop being used?
turn.2: Analog network analyzers faded from general use for load-flow and fault studies, although some persisted in transient studies for a while longer.
turn.3: what happened to all of the analog network analyzers?
turn.4: Analog analyzers were dismantled and either sold off to other utilities, donated to engineering schools, or scrapped.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The fate of a few analyzers illustrates the trend.
turn.7: What happened to the analyzers that were donated?
turn.8: The analyzer purchased by American Electric Power was replaced by digital systems in 1961, and donated to Virginia Tech.
turn.9: Were there any other analyzers that were donated?
turn.10: The Westinghouse network analyzer purchased by the State Electricity Commission of Victoria, Australia in 1950 was taken out of utility service in 1967 and donated to the Engineering department at Monash University; but by 1985, even instructional use of the analyzer was no longer practical and the system was finally dismantled.
turn.11: Why did the analyzers stop being used?
turn.12: One factor contributing to the obsolescence of analog models was the increasing complexity of interconnected power systems.
